tp.pr5.view.gui

Class NavigationPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • tp.pr5.view.gui.NavigationPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, NavigationObserver, ObserverInterface

    public class NavigationPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements NavigationObserver
    This class is in charge of the panel that displays the information about the robot heading and the city that is traversing. It contains the grid that represents the city in the Swing interface, a text area to show the place descriptions, and a label with an icon which represents the robot heading The 11x11 grid contains PlaceCell objects and the first place starts at (5,5). This panel will update the visited places when the robot moves from one place to another. Additionally it will show the place description on a text area if the user clicks on a visited place.
    Author:
    Abel Serrano Juste
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • updateMovingToPlace

        public void updateMovingToPlace(PlaceInfo currentPlace,
                       Direction currentHeading)
        Update the actual place where WALLE stays. The position of the place cell is chosen according to the direction of the movement.
        Specified by:
        updateMovingToPlace in interface NavigationObserver
        Parameters:
        currentPlace - new place where robot is in after move
        currentHeading - heading to move.
